intro: Barkhausia rodigioides, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a compact, bushy habit. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and somewhat woody. Barkhausia rodigioides is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
